data.title: Famous Deaths on August 6
data.meta_description: Famous deaths for the 6th of August. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals died throughout history on August 6.
data.text:
Saint Sixtus II, bishop of Rome (257-58), beheaded under orders of Emperor Valerian

Hormisdas, Pope (514-23) reunited Eastern and Western Churches, dies

Berengarius II, markgraaf of Ivrea/king of Italy (950-963)

Ramon Berenguer IV, Count of Barcelona

Henry de Leeuw, duke of Saxon/Bayern, dies

Saint Dominic, Castilian Catholic priest, founder of the Dominican Order, and patron saint of astronomers, dies at 50

Stephen V, King of Hungary and Croatia (1270-72), son of Béla IV, dies at 32 or 33

Margaret of Durazzo, queen consort of Naples and Hungary, regent of Naples (1386-93) for her son, dies of the plague at 65

King Ladislas of Naples (b. 1377)

Callixtus III [Alfonso the Borja], Pope (1455-58), dies at 79

Georg Rhau, German cantor, composer, and music publisher, dies at about 50 [exact birthdate uncertain c. 1488]

Anne Hathaway, wife of English playwright William Shakespeare, dies aged 66 or 67

Johannes Junius, Mayor of Bamberg (b. 1573)

Ben Jonson

English playwright and poet (Volpone, Alchemist), dies at 65

Lionel Cranfield, 1st Earl of Middlesex, English merchant, dies at 70

Bohdan Khmelnytsky, Polish-Lithuanian military leader of Zaporozhian Cossacks (organized rebellion of Ukrainian Cossacks against the Polish), dies (b. c. 1595)

Diego Velázquez, Spanish painter (Las Meninas), dies at 61

Jacqueline-Marie-Angélique Arnauld, French abbess (Port-Royal de Paris), dies at about 70

Tsjerk Hiddes de Vries, Dutch admiral, dies in battle at 43

John Snell, British royalist, dies at 49 or 50

Paul Hainlein, German trumpet maker and composer (Battallia Sonata), dies at 60

François de Harlay de Champvallon, Archbishop of Paris, dies at 69

Jacob F Muller [Sjako/Jaco], German Dutch thief 'the Robin Hood of Amsterdam', beheaded at 28

François Valentijn, Dutch vicar and writer (Old and New East-India), dies at 61

Christian VI, King of Denmark and Norway, dies at 46

Georg Wilhelm Richmann, Russian-Baltic physicist, dies when struck by lightning during an experiment at 42

Stepan Fyodorovich Apraksin, Russian general who commanded Russian armies during the Seven Years' War, dies at 56

Eugene Aram, English philologist (b. 1704)

Heinrich Nikolaus Gerber, German composer, dies at 72

Willem Bachiene, Dutch vicar, theologist, geographer and astronomer, dies at 70

Karl Kohaut, Austrian composer and lutenist, dies at 57

Henry Bathurst, 2nd Earl Bathurst, British politician (b. 1714)

Joseph Friebert, Austrian composer, dies at 74

James A. Bayard (elder), United States Senator from Delaware (b. 1767)

Karl Frieberth, Austrian composer, dies at 80

Antonin Vranicky, Czech composer and violinist, dies at 59

1820 Princess Frederica Charlotte of Prussia, Duchess of York and Albany, dies at 53

Antonio Bartolomeo Bruni, Italian composer and conductor, dies at 64

Konstantin von Benckendorff, Russian general and statesman, dies of a fever at 43

Nicola Vaccai, Italian composer, dies at 58

Edward Walsh, Irish poet (b. 1805)

Josif Josifovich Genishta, Russian pianist, composer, and conductor, dies at 57

Francisco Acuña de Figueroa, Uruguayan poet (Toraidas), dies at 71

John Mason Neale, English divine, scholar and hymnwriter (b. 1818)

James Springer White, American theologian (co-founder of the Seventh-day Adventist Church), dies at 60

Robert Spear Hudson, English businessman, dies at 71

Wilhelm Scherer, German literature historian, dies at 45

Jean-Jacques Challet-Venel, member of the Swiss Federal Council (b. 1811)

George Frederick Root, American songwriter ("The Battle Cry of Freedom"), dies at 74

Wilhelm Liebknecht, German socialist (Social Democratic Party), dies at 74

Eduard Hanslick, German music critic, dies at 78

Ellen Axson Wilson (née Ellen Louise Axson), American artist and First Lady (US, 1913-14; New Jersey, 1911-13), dies of Bright's Disease during President Woodrow Wilson's 1st term, at 54

Stefan Bastyr, Polish pioneering aviator, first flight in independent Poland, dies in a plane crash at 29

John Henry Roberts, Welsh organist, hymn composer, and pedagogue, dies at 76

Gregorio Ricci-Curbastro, Italian mathematician (tensor analysis), dies at 72

W. H. Grattan Flood, Irish author and composer, dies at 68

(Leon Bismarck) "Bix" Beiderbecke, American jazz cornetist - one of the most influential jazz soloists of the 1920s, pianist, and composer (In A Mist), dies of alcoholism exacerbated pneumonia at 28

Hermann Glauert, British aerodynamicist, dies at 41

Alexander Winkler, Russian composer, dies at 70

Annie Horniman, English theater owner (Abbey Theatre, Dublin), dies at 76

1937 Ferdinand CS Schiller, British philosopher (Mind!), dies at 72

Warner Oland, Swedish actor (The Jazz Singer, Charlie Chan), dies at 58

Tom Garrett, Australian cricket all-rounder (19 Tests, TS 51no, 34 wickets; NSW CA), dies at 85

Hiram Johnson, American progressive politician, US Senator, Governor of California (1911-17), dies at 78

1945 Prince Wu of Korea (b. 1912)

Benny Lynch, Scottish boxer (World flyweight title 1937-38), dies of malnutrition-induced respiratory failure at 33

Blanche Bingley

British tennis player (Wimbledon 1886, 89, 94, 97, 99-1900), dies at 82

Tony Lazzeri

American Baseball HOF second baseman (World Series x 5; only player to complete natural cycle with grand slam; NY Yankees), dies from a fall caused by a heart attack at 42

Cyril Walker, English golfer (US Open 1924), dies of pleural pneumonia at 55

David Fairchild, American botanist and explorer (introduced over 200,000 plants to US), dies at 85

1954 Theo Van Reijn, Dutch sculptor and lithograph, dies at 70

Johan Frans van Bemmelen, Dutch zoologist, dies at 96

Preston Sturges [Edmund Biden], American director and screenwriter (Sullivan's Travels), dies at 60

Jozef-Ernest van Roey, Belgian cardinal (opposed Nazism as Archbishop of Mechelen), dies at 87

Tom Keene, American actor (Our Daily Bread), dies of cancer at 68

Cedric Hardwicke, British stage actor (Rope; Suspicion; Peter Pan; Richard III), dies at 71

Aksel Sandemose, writer, dies

1965 Everett Sloane, American actor (Patsy, Citizen Kane, Enforcer), dies of apparent suicide with barbiturates at 55

1965 Nancy Carroll, actress (Alice-Aldrich Family), dies at 60

1965 Peter Ronnefeld, German pianist, composer and conductor (Die Nachtausgabe), dies at 30

Cordwainer Smith [Paul Myron Anthony Linebarger], American sci-fi author (Space Lords), dies at 53

Ernest Burnelle, Belgian politician (Communist Party of Belgium (PCB)), dies at 60

Theodor W. Adorno

German philosopher and sociologist (Dialectic of Enlightenment, Negative Dialectics), dies at 65

Ingolf Dahl [Marcus], German-American pianist and composer (Allegro and Arioso), dies at 56

Fulgencio Batista

Dictator and President of Cuba (1933-44, 1952-59), dies of a heart attack at 72

James Beck, British actor (Dad's Army), dies from pancreatitis at 44

1973 Memphis Minnie [Lizzie Douglas], American blues musician, dies at 76

Gene Ammons, American jazz saxophonist ("The Happy Blues"), dies of bone cancer at 49

Gregor Piatigorsky, Ukrainian-American cellist, dies at 73

Edward Durrell Stone, US architect, dies at 76

Paul VI

262nd Roman Catholic pope (1963-78), dies of a heart attack at 80

Kurt Kaszner [Serwicher], Austrian actor (Kiss Me Kate, Lili, Casino Royale), dies of cancer at 65

Charles Urbanus, Dutch baseball player, dies at 66

1980 Marino Marini, Italian sculptor (The Pilgrim - Houston), dies at 79

Klaus Nomi [Sperber], German new wave singer, and performance artist, dies of AIDS at 39

Forbes Burnham, Premier Guyana (1964-85), dies during surgery at 62

Emilio Fernandez, Mexican director (La Choca, Flor Silvestre), dies at 82

1986 Manfred Hausmann, writer, dies at 87

1986 William J Schroeder, (longest-survivor with permanent artificial) heart, dies at 54, after 620 days with Jarvik VII man-made pump)

Ira C Eaker, commandant USAF in Europe (WWII), dies at 91

1987 Sherwood Bailey, actor (Spud-Our Gang), dies

Anatoly Levchenko, Soviet cosmonaut (TM-4), dies of a brain tumor at 47

1988 J. Skelly Wright, American judge (anti-segregationist), dies at 77

Charles Arnt, actor (Double Exposure), dies of pancreatic cancer at 82

1990 Gordon Metcalfe, American actor (Monster in the Closet), dies of AIDS at 43

1990 Jacques Soustelle, French anthropologist and Minister of Information (Free French forces), dies at 78

1990 Mário Pinto de Andrade, Angolan poet and politician who founded the Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), dies at 62

1990 Robert Alex, shot to death by robber at 31

Harry Reasoner

American newscaster (60 Minutes, ABC, CBS), dies at 68

Roland Michener, 20th Governor General of Canada (1967-74), dies at 91

1991 Shapour Bakhtiar, Iranian politician (Prime Minister, for 36 days in 1979), assassinated in his home in Suresnes. France at 79

Milt Thompson, American astronaut (Dynasoar, X-15), NASA test pilot and chief-engineer, dies at 67

Domenico Modugno, Italian singer-songwriter (Volare), dies at 66

André Fleury, French organist and composer, dies at 92

1995 Paul James Nunn, mountaineer, dies at 52

1995 Youly Algaroff, Russian-French ballet dancer, dies at 77

Buland al-Haidary, Iraqi poet (Passages to Exile), dies at 69

1996 Gerry Gomez, West Indian cricket all-rounder (29 Tests, 1 x 100, HS 101, 58 wickets, BB 7/55; Trinidad), dies from a heart attack at 76

1996 Hernán Siles Zuazo, Bolivian politician (President of Bolivia 1956-60, 1982-85), dies at 82

1996 Leonard John Coldwell, cricketer, dies at 63

1996 Muhammad al-Badr, magnate of Northern Yemen (1962), dies

1996 Ossie Clark, British fashion designer of the Swinging Sixities, stabbed to death by a former lover at 54

1996 Richard M. Goodwin, American mathematician and economist (The Dynamics of A Capitalist Economy), dies at 83

André Weil, French mathematician (foundational work in number theory and algebraic geometry), dies at 92

1998 Nat Gonella, British big band jazz trumpeter, mellophonist, singer, and bandleader (The Georgians; Oh, Monah), dies at 90

Ilse Pausin, Austrian figure skater (Olympic silver pairs 1936; World C'ship silver x 5 [with brother Erik Pausin]), dies at 80

Dorothy Tutin, British actress (Importance of Being Ernest, Cromwell), dies at 71

2001 Jorge Amado de Faria, Brazilian writer (O Pais do Carnaval), dies at 88

2001 Larry Adler, American pop and classical harmonica player, and composer, dies of cancer at 87

2001 Wilhelm Mohnke, one of the original 120 members of the Nazi SS-Staff Guard (b. 1911)

Edsger Dijkstra, Dutch computer scientist (b. 1930)

Rick James

American funk musician ("Super Freak"), dies of pulmonary failure and cardiac failure at 56

(William) "Keter" Betts, American jazz double bassist (Dinah Washington; Charlie Byrd; Ella Fitzgerald), dies of a heart attack at 77

2005 Carlo Little, English rock drummer (Screaming Lord Sutch & the Savages), dies of lung cancer at 66

2005 Crème Puff, world's oldest recorded cat, dies in Texas aged 38 years and 3 days [1]

2005 Ibrahim Ferrer, Cuban singer (Los Bocucos, 1959-91; Buena Vista Social Club), dies at 78

2005 James Wilson, English-Irish classical composer (Grinning At The Devil), dies at 82

2005 Robin Cook, British politician (b. 1946)

Atle Selberg, Norwegian mathematician (number theory), dies at 90

2007 Heinz Barth, German convicted war criminal and former member of the Nazi SS, dies at 86

2007 Teizo Matsumura, Japanese composer ("Chinmoku / Silence"; "Hymn to Aurora") and haiku poet, dies at 78

2007 Zsolt Daczi, Hungarian rock guitarist (Bikini; Omen; Carpathia Project Tirana Rockers; solo), dies at 38

Jud Taylor, American actor (Dr. Kildare (TV series) - "Dr. Gerson"), and director (Tail Gunner Joe), dies at 76

Bahadır Akkuzu, Turkish rock guitarist and singer (Kurtalan Ekspres), dies of a heart attack at 54

2009 John Hughes, American film director (Breakfast Club; Ferris Bueller's Day Off), dies of a heart attack at 59

2009 Willibrordus S. Rendra, Indonesian poet (Ballad orang-orang tertjina), dies at 73

2009 Willy Deville [William Paul Borsey Jr.], American rock vocalist and guitarist (Mink DeVille; The Princess Bride - "Storybook Love"), dies of pancreatic cancer at 58

Fe del Mundo, Filipino pediatrician and National Scientist of the Philippines, dies at 99

2011 Mark Hatfield, American politician (29th Governor of Oregon), dies at 89

Dan Roundfield, American basketball forward (3-time NBA All Star), dies from drowning at 59

2012 Marvin Hamlisch, American composer and conductor (The Sting; A Chorus Line), dies of respiratory arrest at 68

2012 Robert Hughes, Australian art critic and writer (Barcelona), dies at 74

2012 Ruggiero Ricci, American composer and violinist (Paganini), dies from heart failure at 94

2012 Sir Bernard Lovell, English radio astronomer, dies at 98

LeRoy Pearce, American collegiate athlete and college football coach, 1950-70 (University of Miami, University of Tennessee, University of Arkansas, and 3 others), dies of complications from Alzheimer's disease at 86

Louise Suggs

American golfer and co-founder of LPGA (11 major titles, US Open 1949, 52), dies of natural causes at 91

Helen Delich Bentley, American politician (Rep-R-MD, 1985-950), dies at 92

2016 Pete Fountain [Pierre LaFontaine], American jazz and Dixieland clarinetist (Lawrence Welk, 1957-59), dies at 86

Betty Cuthbert

Australian athlete (Olympic gold 100m, 200m, 4x100m 1956; 400m 1964), dies from dementia at 79

Darren Daulton, American baseball catcher (MLB All-Star 1992, 93, 95; World Series 1997; Silver Slugger Award 1992; Philadelphia Phillies), dies of brain cancer at 55

Joël Robuchon, French chef, world record for Michelin stars (32), dies of cancer at 73

2018 Margaret Heckler, American politician and 15th U.S. Secretary of Health & Human Services (1983-85), dies at 87

2018 Paul Laxalt, American politician (22nd Governor of Nevada), dies at 96

Maurice Simon, American jazz saxophonist, dies at 90

Brent Scowcroft, American Air Force officer and National Security advisor, dies at 95

2020 Wayne Fontana [Glyn Geoffrey Ellis], British rocker (The Mindbenders - "The Game Of Love"), dies at 74

2020 Wilbert McClure, American boxer (Olympic gold light middleweight 1960), dies at 81

Herbert Schlosser, American television executive (NBC - hired Johnny Carson; championed Laugh-In; conceptualized Saturday Night Live), dies at 95

2021 Kenneth Nichols, Canadian classical pianist, composer, (Symphonic Celebration; Boy In A Cage), and teacher (Brandon University, 1962-96), dies at 85

David Muse, American rock and smooth jazz saxophonist and flutist (Firefall - "You Are The Woman"; Marshall Tucker Band), dies of cancer at 73

2022 Gene Visscher, American college basketball coach (Weber State University 1971-74; Northern Arizona University 1981-83), dies at 81

David LaFlamme, American electric rock violinist (It's A Beautiful Day - "White Bird"), dies at 82

Connie Chiume, South African filmmaker and actress known for "Black Panther", dies at 72 [1]

August 6 Highlights
